ratings.comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Cravens certainly has a passion for linguistics... But his instruction is entirely arbitrary. Exams are entirely unpredictable. He gives review sheets. Sometimes exams are based completely off of them. Sometimes they do not even relate. You will not learn anything & your grade is a complete roll of the dice. DO NOT TAKE.

Professor Cravens clearly has an impressive knowledge of linguistics, but he utterly fails to communicate effectively. His lectures are all over the place and are clearly not directed at linguistic beginners. That said, exams are reasonable, and texts are unnecessary. All told, would not recommend.

Professor Cravens obviously knows everything there is to know about the subject of romance language linguistics and is as nice a guy as they come.  But that being said, this was without a doubt the worst class I've taken at UW.  I didn't learn a thing, he has absolutely no command or structure of the class, and arbitrarily grades things.  AVOID!!!!

Prof. Cravens is brilliant when it comes to romance linguistics. The class isn't so much learning new facts as it is questioning what you think you knew about italian, and he facilitates. That said, having some experience in linguistics is very helpful to follow along in class because terms get thrown around a lot. Very interesting class overall,

I studied Linguistics with Dr. Cravens at Loyola College from 1988-1990. He was by far one of the best professors I have ever had. He inspired me to better appreciate not only language but also culture, and 20 years later, I still consider him to have been one of the most impactful people in my adult life.

This class is really easy. Just show up, pay attention, and you'll do well. He wants you to do well, so there are no tricks. JUST SHOW UP! Don't waste your money on the textbooks--you don't need them. I regret buying them.

Professor Cravens knows Romance Linguistics better than any other teacher at UW. He makes it all very interesting and always holds my attention. I'd absolutely recommend his class to anyone with a genuine interest.

I was really excited to take this class, but not anymore.  I could learn in 10 minutes what we do in 75!  If you haven't had any linguistics classes before, things can be a little confusing.  He's smart, and enthusiastic, but often unclear, overly complicated, and always late.

Incredibly interesting class. Prof. Cravens knows this stuff like the back of his hand, and you can tell he is very excited about it. He really cares about his students' learning.  His tests are very fair and he makes sure the students know the material before he gives them. If you get a chance to take any class with him, do it!

Cravens is a great prof.  He makes boring grammer interesting and easy to understand.  He really looks out for his students best interestes.  Is a little disorganized but assigns little to no homework.  Also very much dislikes giving tests and when he does he looks them over before accepting them.  Great guy and great class

Great class! A little disorganized, but a very nice guy, funny, very approachable, full of good examples, knows his languages. His class made me want to pursue historical linguistics. You learn a lot, but he hates to quantify your knowledge by giving tests. Take this class if you get the chance!
